arm_group.arm_group_label: Omega-3 fatty acid ethyl esters 2 g
arm_group.description: Omega-3 fatty acid ethyl esters 2 g, administered orally once or twice daily after meals

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of long-term use of
      granular capsule formulation of omega-3 fatty acid ethyl esters (Lotriga Granular Capsules)
      in patients with hyperlipidemia in daily medical practice

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Long-term Use of Lotriga

detailed_description.textblock:
This special drug use surveillance on long-term use of granular capsule formulation of
      omega-3 fatty acid ethyl esters (Lotriga Granular Capsules) was designed to investigate the
      frequency of adverse events in patients with hyperlipidemia The usual adult dosage is 2 g of
      omega-3 fatty acid ethyl esters administered orally once daily after meals. However, the
      dosage can be increased up to twice daily (at a dose of 2 g) depending on the patient's
      triglyceride level.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with hyperlipidemia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  (1) Patients with hemorrhage (e.g., hemophilia, capillary fragility, gastrointestinal
             ulcer, urinary tract hemorrhage, hemoptysis, or vitreous hemorrhage) (2) Patients
             with a history of hypersensitivity to ingredients in Lotriga Granular Capsules

intervention.arm_group_label: Omega-3 fatty acid ethyl esters 2 g
intervention.description: Omega-3 fatty acid ethyl esters granular capsules

clinical_study.official_title: Lotriga Granular Capsules Special Drug Use Surveillance (Long-term Use Survey)

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare

primary_outcome.description: The frequencies of all adverse events observed during the observation period will be tabulated by type and seriousness. Adverse events are defined as unfavorable and unintended signs, symptoms or diseases temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, regardless of relationship to the medicinal product.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: For lipid parameters such as triglycerides (TG), total cholesterol (TC), LDL cholesterol (LDL-C), HDL cholesterol (HDL-C), Non-HDL- C, observed values (or converted values) and percent changes (%) from baseline in these  valuesare tabulated at each  observational point.
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in lipid parameters

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
